intro: Dissochaeta microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and tiny, four-lobed fruits. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
